content.description: Stand start on a positive matachble edge. Climb up and right onto the arete - difficulty eases up high. Most of the problem gets decent shade in the morning and gets full sun past 1-3PM depending on time of year.
content.location: This large boulder is approximately 100 feet from the barbed wire fence - this problem is pretty obious line of holds on the arete. W - SW facing.

content.description: Sit start low and climb out the steepness utilizing some roof trickery. Difficult finish to gain the jug rail and a casual mantle.
content.location: From the Serengeti boulder hike directly uphill approximately 300 yards - this boulder faces east and gets plenty of shade in the afternoon.

content.description: Stand start on decent holds from a small pad stack - somewhat slabby crux early leads to more powerful climbing on more positive holds near the top. Technical sit start goes, but I couldn't even do it.
content.location: West facing prow feature on the Serengeti boulder. Gets full shade all morning until somewhere around 2 when it gets full sun.

content.description: South - Southwest facing boulders near the base of Granite Mountain. Pockets of great stone and a lot of choss. You won't see many folks out here.
